meanings.definition: To discourage or prevent someone from doing something
meanings.sent1: The loud noise deterred the cat from jumping on the table.
meanings.sent2: The warning sign deterred people from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: The clever mouse deterred the cat by hiding in a tiny hole.
meanings.sent4: The bright light deterred the insects from flying too close.
meanings.sent5: The strong smell of the repellent deterred the mosquitoes effectively.

meanings.definition: To prevent or discourage someone from taking action
meanings.sent1: The security guard deterred the thief from stealing the valuable painting.
meanings.sent2: The high price of the item deterred customers from making a purchase.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey deterred the zookeeper by throwing bananas at him.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog deterred the drivers from speeding on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The fierce growl of the dog deterred the strangers from approaching the house.
